maml:description.maml:para: Compare revisions.
Views dependency differences between two revisions of the same EdgeWorker activation. You can specify an EdgeWorker by its name or ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier of the revision to compare against.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorkers revision.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier of the revision to compare against.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the Edge Worker.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorkers revision.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.

This is an internal function used to retrieve EdgeWorkers and their versions more easily in other commands.

Get an activation.

Gets all EdgeWorker activations or returns a specific activation record by its ID. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name, ID, or version. The `-Version` parameter is a specific version number or the word `latest`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker activation.

When enabled, limits results to show only currently activate versions. Pair this with a network to get the version that's currently active on a specific network. Otherwise the response may include up to two versions.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker activation.

When enabled, limits results to show only currently activate versions. Pair this with a network to get the version that's currently active on a specific network. Otherwise the response may include up to two versions.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the Edge Worker.

Download an EdgeWorkers code bundle.

Downloads the bundle containing the code the EdgeWorker executes. If you specify the `-OutputFile` (which is the default), the code bundle will be written to a .tgz file. Alternatively, you can specify the `-OutputDirectory`, upon which the .tgz bundle will be extracted to the given directory. > Note: You need to have the `tar` command available on your system to run this operation.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Directory to extract bundle contents into.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
TGZ filename to save bundle contents to.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Get an EdgeWorker report.

Gets all EdgeWorker reports or returns an individual report by its ID. > Note: If you want to get a specific report, you need to provide other mandatory details, including the start and end date of the report, EdgeWorker ID, and EdgeWorker status.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Filter by EdgeWorker ID such as `42` or more specific version such as `42-1.0`.
ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the end time of the EdgeWorker report. If not specified, the end time defaults to the current time.
Filter EdgeWorkers by the event that triggers them, either `onClientRequest`, `onOriginRequest`, `onOriginResponse`, `onClientResponse`, or `responseProvider`.
Unique identifier of an EdgeWorker report.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the start time of the EdgeWorker report.

Filter by the EdgeWorker status, either `success`, `genericError`, `unknownEdgeWorkerId`, `unimplementedEventHandler`, `runtimeError`, `executionError`, `timeoutError`, `resourceLimitHit`, `cpuTimeoutError`, `wallTimeoutError`, `initCpuTimeoutError`, or `initWallTimeoutError`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Filter by EdgeWorker ID such as `42` or more specific version such as `42-1.0`.
ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the end time of the EdgeWorker report. If not specified, the end time defaults to the current time.
Filter EdgeWorkers by the event that triggers them, either `onClientRequest`, `onOriginRequest`, `onOriginResponse`, `onClientResponse`, or `responseProvider`.
Unique identifier of an EdgeWorker report.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the start time of the EdgeWorker report.

Filter by the EdgeWorker status, either `success`, `genericError`, `unknownEdgeWorkerId`, `unimplementedEventHandler`, `runtimeError`, `executionError`, `timeoutError`, `resourceLimitHit`, `cpuTimeoutError`, `wallTimeoutError`, `initCpuTimeoutError`, or `initWallTimeoutError`.
Get resource tiers.
Views the list of available resource tiers for a specific contract ID. The resource tier defines the resource consumption limits for an EdgeWorker ID.

Get a revision.

Gets all revisions of an EdgeWorker or retrieves an individual revision by its ID. To limit the results when listing all revisions, use the filter parameters, such as `-Version`, `-ActivationID`, `-Network`, `-PinnedOnly`, and `-CurrentlyPinned`. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name or ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker activation.
When enabled, limits results to show only revisions that are currently pinned.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
When enabled, limits results to show only currently or previously pinned revisions.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorkers revision.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker activation.
When enabled, limits results to show only revisions that are currently pinned.

When enabled, limits results to show only currently or previously pinned revisions.

Get a revision BOM.
Views the Bill of Materials (BOM) for a specific revision. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name or ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
When enabled, limits results to show only active versions.
When enabled, shows additional information about the revision that's currently pinned.
When enabled, limits results to show only the pinned revisions when the BOM was created.

Download the combined code bundle.

Downloads the combined code bundle that contains the code and dependencies that the EdgeWorker executes. You can save the bundle as a .tgz file (by default) and optionally specify the filename with the `-OutputFile` parameter. Alternatively, you can extract the files into the `-OutputDirectory`. You can specify an EdgeWorker by its name or ID. > Note: This operation requires that your OS have the `tar` command configured (*nix, Windows 10 1803 and later).
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Directory to extract bundle contents into.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorkers revision.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
TGZ filename to save bundle contents to.

Get version details.

Gets all versions of a given EdgeWorker or returns a specific Edgeworker version. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name, ID, or version. For the `-Version` parameter, you can either omit it or provide a specific version number or the word `latest`.

Activate an EdgeWorker version.
Activates an existing EdgeWorker version on Akamai's staging or production network.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the Edge Worker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Name of the Edge Worker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Create a secure token.
Generates a JWT authentication token to enable enhanced debug headers (https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgeworkers/docs/enable-enhanced-debug-headers)for EdgeWorkers.
Comma-separated list of hostnames to limit the scope of your auth token. Without this your token will be valid for all hosts, providing you have access to all in a single account.
Number of minutes before the authentication token expires, from 1 to 720 minutes, or 12 hours. The default is `480` for 8 hours.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Number of minutes before the authentication token expires, from 1 to 720 minutes, or 12 hours. The default is `480` for 8 hours.
Comma-separated list of hostnames to limit the scope of your auth token. Without this your token will be valid for all hosts, providing you have access to all in a single account.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Deactivate an EdgeWorker version.

Deactivates an existing EdgeWorker version on Akamai's staging or production network. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name, ID, or version. The `-Version` parameter is a specific version number or the word `latest`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the Edge Worker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Name of the Edge Worker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker version. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Activate a fallback revision.
Reactivates a previously active revision on Akamai's staging or production network. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name or ID
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Note to specify why the revision is being reactivated.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorkers revision.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Note to specify why the revision is being reactivated.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Name of the Edge Worker.
Note to specify why the revision is being reactivated.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorkers revision.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create a new version.

Creates a new version of an EdgeWorker based on either the .tgz `-CodeBundle` or a point to a directory with the `-CodeDirectory` parameter. If you opt for the directory option, all files in the directory (except the existing .tgz files) will be included in the bundle. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name or ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Location of local TGZ file containing your Edge Worker code.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the Edge Worker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Location of local TGZ file containing your Edge Worker code.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Local directory containing your Edge Worker code. Note: requires that your operating system contains the tar command.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Name of the Edge Worker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Local directory containing your Edge Worker code. Note: requires that your operating system contains the tar command.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Location of local TGZ file containing your Edge Worker code.
Local directory containing your Edge Worker code. Note: requires that your operating system contains the tar command.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
Name of the Edge Worker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Deletes a specific EdgeWorker ID. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name or ID.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Name of the Edge Worker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Cancel an activation.

Cancels a pending activation. You can cancel any activation whose status is still `PRESUBMIT`, `PENDING`, or IN_PROGRESS. After that, you need to wait for activation to complete and then deactivate it. Once deactivation is complete, you can then delete the EdgeWorker version. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either its name or ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker activation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Validate an EdgeWorkers code bundle.

Checks your EdgeWorker code bundle for validation errors. You can either specify the `-CodeBundle` as a local .tgz file or use the `-CodeDirectory` parameter to automatically compress a given directory and validate its content.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Location of local TGZ file containing your Edge Worker code.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Roll back to the previous active EdgeWorker version.
Reactivates the EdgeWorker version that was previously active on Akamai's staging or production network. You can specify an EdgeWorker by either name or ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for an EdgeWorker.

When enabled, limits results to show only versions activated on a specific network, either STAGING or PRODUCTION. Pair this with activeOnNetwork=true to get the version that's currently active on the specified network.
Note to specify why the revision is being reactivated.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
